data.description: No wonder one always tends to kick off their international beginning on a high. Australia’s Jake Fraser-McGurk bore a lot of anticipation among the fans ahead of his T20I debut but it turned out to be a nightmare as the youngster failed to flourish against Scotland in the first T20I in Edinburgh.

data.author: Arijit Kundu
data.title: ‌SCO vs AUS | Twitter reacts to Head Hurricane steamroll Scotland in Australia’s thumping win
data.description: Australia peppered Scotland by seven wickets and 62 balls in hand to go one-up in the three-match series. Following a disciplined Aussie bowling reducing the Scottish XI to 154, Travis Head’s dynamic 25-ball 80 coupled with Mitchell Marsh’s 12-ball 39 drubbed the home side convincingly.

data.author: Debayan Sinha
data.title: Ajay Ratra takes on new role as member of BCCI Mens Selection Committee
data.description: The Board of Control for Cricket in India (BCCI) has appointed former India wicketkeeper Ajay Ratra as a member of the Men's Selection Committee. Ratra will replace Salil Ankola on the committee, which is led by Ajit Agarkar and includes Shiv Sundar Das, Subroto Banerjee, and Sridharan Sharath.

data.title: ‌Prasidh Krishna ruled out of Duleep Trophy’s first round
data.description: Karnataka pacer Prasidh Krishna is not fit to take part in the first round of the 2024 Duleep Trophy, as confirmed by Shubman Gill, the captain of India A. He failed to recover from surgery in due time and will not take part in the encounter against India B at the M. Chinnaswamy Stadium, Bengaluru.
